11:55 <+sburjan> Hello. How can I install the template to use old xem wikis ?  
11:56 <+tmortagne> sburjan: you should still have the old XEM install page  
11:56 <+tmortagne> not sure if it has been renamed  
11:56 <+tmortagne> search a page with install in its name in the document index  
11:57 <+sburjan> yes, I am in the Wiki Manager application. And I want to create an old school XEM. But i don't have the template. I only have the workspaces template  
11:58 <+tmortagne> sburjan: I understood what you said and the old XEM install page which create this template it still supposed to be here  
11:58 <+tmortagne> it used to be XemManager.Install  
11:58 <+tmortagne> looks like it's still the same  
11:59 <+sburjan> yes, it's here. thanks.  
11:59 <+sburjan> it doesn't have a nice entry point. but I guess this is not an issue  
12:00 <+tmortagne> sburjan: well it does not because XEM is now workspaces and just did not removed the old pages "in case of"  
12:01 <+sburjan> and if someone wants an old style xem what can he do  ?(if we remove the old pages)  
12:02 <+tmortagne> sburjan: right now the old XEM is supposed to be created "by hand" from XE AFAIK  
12:02 <+tmortagne> (install wiki manager, etc.)  
12:02 <+sburjan> tmortagne: thanks for the info  
12:03 <+tmortagne> note that before XEM become workspaces we were about to delete XEM anyway so that you created it from XE, I think there is even a vote for it

14:18 <+Enygma`> FIY, I have moved http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8203 to 4.3-milestone-1  
14:18 <+Enygma`> tmortagne: could you please make some time and fill in the documentation for these remaining issues? http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/IssueNavigator!executeAdvanced.jspa?jqlQuery=Project+in+%28%22XWiki+Commons%22%2C+%22XWiki+Rendering%22%2C+%22XWiki+Platform%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise%22%2C+%22XWiki+Enterprise+Manager%22%29+and+fixVersion+in+%28%224.2-rc-1%22%29+and+resolution+in+%28%22Fixed%22%29+and+%28%28Documentation+is+EMPTY%29+or+%28%22Documentation+in+Rele  
14:19 <+sburjan> yes, bucause we haven't yet decided what we'll do with it  
14:19 <+tmortagne> Enygma`: sure, it's probably all N/A always forget them  
14:19 <+tmortagne> note that the link in IRC is not complete  
14:19 <+Enygma`> ah, so they don`t impact the RN  
14:19 <+tmortagne> checking  
14:20 <+Enygma`> link to list of jira issues?  
14:20 <+tmortagne> yes  
14:20 <+Enygma`> I`ve just clicked on it and it worked for me  
14:20 <+tmortagne> you are the one sending it :)  
14:20 <+tmortagne> IRC cut too long lines  
14:21 <+tmortagne> the one from the release plan does not seems to work  
14:21 <+tmortagne> looks like it's not properly escaped or somehting  
14:21 <+Enygma`> that one works for me too :)  
14:22 <+Enygma`> that`s how I got to it  
14:22 <+Enygma`> weird  
14:22 <+tmortagne> well I just clicked on it and I loose all "  
14:22 <+tmortagne> all the %22  
14:22 <+Enygma`> clicked again from http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ReleasePlan42RC1 and it worked  
14:22 <+Enygma`> funny :)  
14:22 <+tmortagne> what browser ?  
14:22 <+Enygma`> Project in ("XWiki Commons", "XWiki Rendering", "XWiki Platform", "XWiki Enterprise", "XWiki Enterprise Manager") and fixVersion in ("4.2-rc-1") and resolution in ("Fixed") and ((Documentation is EMPTY) or ("Documentation in Release Notes" is EMPTY))  
14:23 <+Enygma`> Firefox  
14:23 <+Enygma`> that is the query, above  
14:23 <+tmortagne> same here  
14:23 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
14:23 <+tmortagne> what's weird is that I can see them in the source  
14:23 <kwoot> Hi all. I am starting yet another installation of xwiki within an organisation. :-)  
14:25 <kwoot> The last time I installed xwiki is some time ago. If tomcat runs, has an xwiki war file, mysql is configured and hibernate config is configured. Why do I get some sql error? xwiki creates everything in an empty db, right?  
14:26 <+tmortagne> kwoot: yep  
14:27 <+tmortagne> you sure you created this DB ?  
14:27 <+tmortagne> what error do you get ?  
14:27 <+tmortagne> note that in case you are in Debian based Linux you have a package for it which make all that very easy  
14:28 <vmassol> hi everyone  
14:28 <vmassol> just back from Paris… was giving a talk this morning about xwiki  
14:28 <vmassol> kwoot: "I am starting yet another installation of xwiki within an organisation" nice :)  
14:29 <kwoot>  mysql -u xwiki -p  
14:29 <kwoot> Enter password:  
14:29 <kwoot> Welcome to the MySQL monitor.  Commands end with ; or \g.  
14:29 <kwoot> Your MySQL connection id is 1056

14:29 <kwoot> mysql> use xwiki  
14:29 <kwoot> Database changed  
14:29 <kwoot> mysql>  
14:29 <kwoot> seems to look good.  
14:30 <Denis> has quit  
14:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:31 <kwoot> I will put the error on pastebin because it is a lot. one minute.  
14:34 <kwoot> http://pastebin.com/rYFURFBu  
14:35 <kwoot> Also still have problems viewing the pricing info on xwiki.com. Can someone email me a pricelist at [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)?  
14:35 <kwoot> for a support contract.  
14:36 <vmassol> kwoot: yep asking someone to do that now  
14:36 <+tmortagne> kwoot: you should have a bit more details in the tomcat log  
14:37 <vmassol> kwoot: Guillaume Lerouge is sending you the information  
14:44 <kwoot> INFO: Starting Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8080  
14:44 <kwoot> 24-sep-2012 14:38:07 org.apache.catalina.startup.Catalina start  
14:44 <kwoot> INFO: Server startup in 16780 ms  
14:44 <kwoot> 2012-09-24 14:38:08,589 [http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/] ERROR o.h.i.SessionFactoryImpl       - Error in named query: listGroupsForUser  
14:44 <kwoot> org.hibernate.hql.ast.QuerySyntaxException: XWikiDocument is not mapped [  
14:44 <kwoot> has quit  
14:45 <kwoot> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <kwoot> Oops, sorry.  
14:45 <kwoot> That is the first part of the error messages. The db is completely emtpy still (no tables) but xwiki makes them the first time, yes?  
14:45 <+tmortagne> kwoot: looks like IRC does not like too much messages :)  
14:46 <kwoot> :-)  
14:46 <+tmortagne> kwoot: would to put your hibernate conf file on pastebin  
14:46 <kwoot> one minute  
14:46 <jvelo> has joined #xwiki  
14:46 <+tmortagne> it's like you did not had any mapping in there  
14:46 <+tmortagne> I never saw this kind of errors  
14:48 <kwoot> http://pastebin.com/D2ErWwqx  
14:48 <kwoot> I think I only uncommented the hsql and installed mysql.  
14:49 <kwoot> it is from xwiki-enterprise-web-4.2-milestone-3.war  
14:51 <kwoot> Hm, let me try a reinstall....  
14:57 <+Enygma`> vmassol, tmortagne, sdumitriu: about https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/b6abb2ee5a67f3495bfeb3fed93e6094595842cd#L0R169 I did not see your previous messages and added the CLIRR exclude myself since I wanted to get on with the release. Now I`m building xwiki-platform as part of the release (almost finished). What should I do: stop the release, revert the commit(s) and start again?  
15:02 <vmassol> would be good if sdumitriu answered  
15:02 <vmassol> since he applied a pull request after the last moment  
15:02 <vmassol> and breaking an api  
15:02 <vmassol> a bit dangerous....  
15:03 <vmassol> ideally we shoudl revert it  
15:03 <vmassol> but it's a bit more work than not reverting it  
15:03 <vmassol> if sdumitriu could answer quickly that would be great  
15:03 <vmassol> also I have no idea how well he tested this  
15:04 <vmassol> that's why BTW that creating a branch ASAP before a RC is a good thing  
15:04 <vmassol> toprevent last moment committers to commit stuff not required for a release  
15:05 <vmassol> there aren't any tests either in this commit  
15:05 <vmassol> so we have no clue if the thing even works  
15:07 <+Enygma`> well, at least nobody uses it yet, so it should not break anything... :)  
15:07 <vmassol> yes for sure  
15:07 <vmassol> we need to clean up the mail api at some point too  
15:08 <vmassol> it' s a mess  
15:08 <vmassol> ok since sergiu is probably not going to reply anytime soon  
15:08 <vmassol> I think you should go ahead and too bad that we're breaking yet another api :(  
15:08 <+tmortagne> +1 to go with it  
15:08 <vmassol> (it means that anyone implementing this interface will be broken)  
15:09 <CIA-122> Eduard Moraru xwiki-platform-4.2-rc-1 \* r4cbe03b https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/4cbe03bddcd04320ddbb2431a9433bb5583ac2e3 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-platform-4.2-rc-1 - http://git.io/GF6iNQ

15:10 <+Enygma`> that was fast, right? :P

15:10 <CIA-122> Eduard Moraru master \* r5e62231 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/5e62231c5510f7d87f78b24e0b0554bac6ec45a9 / (45 files in 45 dirs): [maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration - http://git.io/iM4CBw  
15:20 <+Enygma`> sburjan: anything to add/remove to/from http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise42RC1 regarding testing?  
15:21 <kwoot> I must be getting too old for sysadmin work.  
15:21 <+sburjan> Enygma`: changing now  
15:22 <+tmortagne> kwoot: not on Debian/Ubuntu server ?  
15:22 <+sburjan> Enygma`: done  
15:22 <kwoot> I copied the war file to the webapps dir. started tomcat to unzip the thing, stopped tomcat, edit hibarnate.cfg and copied mysql-jdb in WEB-INF/lib and restarted. Still errors on startup. Doing this all on Ubuntu 12.04.1 (my own workstation).  
15:23 <kwoot> When I do a mysql -u xwiki -pxwiki xwiki it logs me into the db.  
15:23 <+tmortagne> kwoot: in http://pastebin.com/D2ErWwqx you removed the mapping  
15:23 <+tmortagne> <mapping resource="xwiki.hbm.xml"/>     <mapping resource="feeds.hbm.xml"/>     <mapping resource="activitystream.hbm.xml"/>  
15:24 <+tmortagne> I mean commented  
15:24 <+tmortagne> so at least for the first install that's why you get errors  
15:25 <+tmortagne> if you plan to install on Debian/Ubuntu you might really be interested in http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT  
15:25 <+tmortagne> it left you with only the XAR part to take  care of  
15:26 <kwoot> Hm, a mapping where I though were only db settings. let me edit that quickly/  
15:26 <+Enygma`> sburjan: thanks  
15:29 <+tmortagne> kwoot: you should have the mapping repeated in all databases configuration snippets  
15:29 <+tmortagne> in the default hibernate configuration file  
15:32 <kwoot> Got it working! stupid typos. Damn! I should have known better :-)  
15:33 <CIA-122> Eduard Moraru xwiki-enterprise-4.2-rc-1 \* r90dfb93 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/90dfb93cedfb97081024a059aed753680d976833 / pom.xml : [release] Preparing release xwiki-enterprise-4.2-rc-1 - http://git.io/JGv3eQ

17:38 <@sdumitriu> vmassol Enygma`: Right, I forgot about the clirr exclude needed
